content.webTitle: Cricket: County Championship guide First Division – Warwickshire

fields.headline: County Championship preview: Warwickshire
fields.bodyText: Big year for Darren Maddy The all-rounder's leadership of the top order will be key, as will the swing bowling of Chris Woakes In a nutshell Stability is the aim after relegation and promotion in successive years, but the retirement of Ian Salisbury and an injury worry over slow left-armer Ant Botha leave concerns over Warwickshire's ability to dismiss first division sides Ashes factor Warwickshire's best hope of representation is current outcast Ian Bell. Expect the patriotic Edgbaston crowd – Australia arrive there for the third Test – to make more of an impact Foreign flavour A lack of spinning options saw plans to invite back the New Zealand seamer Chris Martin ditched for the off-breaks of his compatriot Jeetan Patel Well I never Warwickshire's best batsman last year was a bespectacled trainee groundsman who had retired in 2006. Tony Frost, a wicketkeeper, averaged 83 in the championship Lawrence Booth Bob Willis's verdict The stronger of the two promoted teams, they should successfully consolidate their place in division one. Their strength lies in their batting, but they appear to be a strong team as Ashley Giles seems to have the squad working well Captain Ian Westwood Coach Ashley Giles 2008: Championship 1st (Div 2) Pro40 6th (Div 2) Friends Provident 4th in Midlands Division Twenty20 quarter-finals In Rikki Clarke (Der), Ateeq Javid (Acad), Keith Barker (Enfield), Shaaiq Choudhry (Leeds/Bradford UCCE) Out Lee Daggett (Nor), Tim Groenewald (Der), Ian Salisbury (retired), Stuart Hole, Luke Parker, Nick James, Michael Powell (all released) Overseas Jeetan Patel (NZ)
